intro: Noronhia verticilliflora, commonly known as the clustered flax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Noronhia verticilliflora thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
